subject: Home Alone
event:
Well, not really alone.  Parris is here, and my minions, and the Cocteau staff, and the cats... but I am not in San Diego at Comicon, and I have to admit, that feels strange.

Staying home was the right decision.  I just got back from Chicago and the Dead shows, and before that it was Europe, and it is hardly as if HBO needed me in San Diego to represent... not with so much of our cast on hand.  I have so much work to do, I am way behind on everything, and I have a wedding to attend in Jersey in a few weeks, and worldcon after that... and if truth be told, San Diego has gotten overwhelming in recent years.  There are always good times catching up with friends, and hanging with the cast, but it's not as if I can walk the floor anymore and look for old comic books, the way I once did.

Even so... even so... it does make me a little sad, not being there.

Anyway, those of you who are there, be sure and catch THE EXPANSE premiere.  I wish I could.  Everything I've seen suggests that it will be a terrific show.  The books were certainly great.  Say hi to Daniel and Ty for me.

You might also visit the Random House booth to buy a calendar, and drop by the Tor/ Macmillan booth to buy a stack of books and show your support.

comments.article: That's bad mojo.
comments.subject: What kind of lunatic invites GRRM to a wedding?

comments.article: I'm sure there's a "Like" button round here somewhere...
comments.subject: Re: What kind of lunatic invites GRRM to a wedding?
Re: What kind of lunatic invites GRRM to a wedding?
Re: What kind of lunatic invites GRRM to a wedding?

comments.article: Man, if there is one occasion where you could walk the floor of a public place, it's in a convention. Get yourself a chewbacca mask and have fun, next time. It will be way less weird in #SDCC than if you ever want to see the Red Square in Moscow and use the same cosplay/disguise :-)

Boycotts in general seem to be counter-productive these days.  It seems that every time some group says they are going to boycott something for political reasons, the loyal opposition show up in force and it ends up as a very large boon for the boycotted.  Think how much business Chick-fil-a got when a boycott was called for.  People who don't believe the same way as Truitt Cathy or particularly like chicken showed up to support free speech.  I suspect the Tor boycott will end much the same way.  Lots of people will buy books that they might not have otherwise.
comments.subject: Supporting Tor

comments.article:
Don't Worry, next year you can go while we're reading the Son of Kong. I was thinking, if TWoW is Son of Kong, I can't imagine who will be ADoS. Son of Cthulhu??

Greetings from Chile

But don't put all his sadness and frustration in the Son of Kong killing more characters!

Don't think about it! *whispers*
comments.subject: Yep! That's sad...

comments.article:
That depends on which characters.

I wouldn't mind some Bolton haggis. :-P
comments.subject: Re: Yep! That's sad...

comments.article: Greetings from Honduras, you know, that little country in Central America. Just wanted to tell you I just bought the first dunken and egg book. Its kinda hard to find your books other than ASOIAF in local stores. Anyway huge fan of your work, and just so you know,  i'm not alone over here, you have a huge fanbase too. Hopefully you can visit our beautiful country one day.

Greetings from El Salvador, that other little country next to Honduras in Central America, as Olvin did, I bought the 5 ASOIAF novel + the 3 Dunk and Egg Novellas,its not easy to get a hand on those in this region, you should come do a greet and meet in Central America someday when you finish the Son of Kong, may the Lord of Light guides you Mr. Martin & seven blessings to you as well.

One interesting thing about the Internet era is that events like Comic-Con are heavily documented between YouTube, Instagram, Twitter and the like. I know it's not the same as going somewhere and experiencing it firsthand, but sometimes I don't feel like I'm missing out, you know?
comments.subject: Internet

comments.article: I love Random House! My rep when I was at Borders (how's that for dating this story) use to bring me hand selected ARCs every time he came to visit and give me an update on Dance (when it still had the cute green cover). I found him again when I went to Independent bookselling. He hand picked me ARCs then too. He retired with the merger though. Random House Ron was the best rep ever.
comments.subject: Random House

comments.article:
George u are never alone, all our fans love u, with their respect ad admiration for your willingness to finish Son of Kong. There is only one thing that i want to say .. is better Godzilla than King Kong. Yes is not a monkey, but it makes a better idea Son of Godzilla for the book....or not?

P.S Just Joking
comments.subject: Respect and...Godzilla

comments.article: Looking forward to THE EXPANSE!  Love the books!
Wow, Didn't know you where a Cat person...what are their names?
comments.subject: Cats?

comments.article: How did you enjoy the Dead shows? Did you have good seats? I saw the Dead at the Garden with Jerry back in the old days and those shows were amazing!
comments.subject: Dead Shows

comments.article:
George, I'm sorry
Being alone sucks but f**** that! You must finish this book! :D
Winter is coming and we still know nothing ...
You are not alone at all.

Mr. Martin,

New fan, first time posting. I was reading the archives of your blog, and I noticed way back in January when all the hullabaloo with people connecting Winds with the new Star Wars flick, you mentioned that you didn't like Return of the Jedi as much as Episodes 4 and 5.

As a total Star Wars geek myself, I gotta ask - What didn't you like about Jedi? It's my favorite of them all, though I understand why people say Empire is the best.

Random question, I know, but this post didn't seem to have a specific topic, so this didn't strike me as "off-topic," which I know you discourage.

Anyhoo, thanks for looking, and your work. Best of luck to you with your busy schedule.
comments.subject: Random Question from Sci-fi Fan

comments.article: Well, for one thing, the whole "blowing up the Death Star" plot did not work for me.  We'd seen that in the first STAR WARS, we did not need to see it again.  They should have come up with a new and better Big Bad, rather than just another Death Star.
comments.subject: Re: Random Question from Sci-fi Fan
Re: Random Question from Sci-fi Fan

comments.article:
don't forget george, this is for the work. this is a good thing, not bad.
many people missed you, but we understand
i'm your brazilian fan! my English is so bad, but my apologies....
comments.subject: you'll be fine

comments.article:
Even so... even so... it does make me a little sad, not being there.

If it makes you feel any better, it's kind of comforting to know that even you couldn't get into Hall H for the Game of Thrones panel.
If you want to explore the cons by yourself again, just tell people that you are trying your best cosplay as George R.R. Martin.
comments.subject: SDCC

comments.article: I can't imagine not being able to walk around without the peace of mind of anonymity. Sounds like donning a mask might be just the ticket for you, though! If I ever saw you I'd probably just say "Hey George!" or "Peace!" and leave it at that. But I'm happy that anything gives you more time to finish the books! Since I started watching the show first, I haven't read them yet, and I am hoping to read them all, soon! Take care and...Peace!
comments.subject: sorry George

comments.article:
I can empathize.

George, I feel bad that you didn't feel you could go, but it will make next year all the sweeter. You'll walk in next year triumphant and full of new accomplishment.

It might not be the ideal solution, but you should go one day in disguise a la Henry V. It's the perfect solution for a Con. I'd love to see you (or not see you as the case may be) in full Storm Trooper gear or as a Brony... maybe even an orc from Lord of the Rings... or even one of your own characters!
comments.subject: Next year will be better anyway.

comments.article:
Have you seen the Tested video where Jamie Hyneman looks for a solution for getting stopped at comicon? He figured that if he took a "yes-man" approach to it but also kept walking, he could satisfy fans and also get to his destination. I don't know how well it could work for browsing comics rather than walking the floor, but if nothing else, it was funny to watch.


(start around 2 minutes in) https://youtu.be/H8sz5Nat4QI?t=122
comments.subject: comicon

comments.article: ok

If it seems like it's gonna be downhill writing (for you of course, a 2 page children's book would be the son of Kong for the lot of us) you could name it curious George as you put a pretty bow around the frey's and boltons and squeeze the life out of them.... If it's tougher then a 2 dollar steak like some of the other masterpieces you have written it could be an unholy bastard offspring of balerion the black dread and Kong. You could name this abomination to the gods both old and new "The Mad Kong" (see what I did there?! Pretty clever)
comments.subject: Name for a dream of spring

comments.article: This might not be a popular opinion, but take your time with TWOW. I'll live if it is released after season 6. I'd rather eat the meal after the food has finished cooking. Good luck!
comments.subject: Take your Time :)

comments.article:
I have to work this week. And next week. And every week until I'm useless.

Boy, now I feel melancholy.
comments.subject: I'm not going to San Diego either
